title: Cursor size with HiDPi
body:
### The Issue:
I came form Plasma KDE to Hyprland and I saw that cursor size with fractional scaling to `1.5` is  too problematic ,  I did  append the typical cursor adjustment with other environment variables form the wiki in my config:

> env = GDK_BACKEND,wayland,x11
env= QT_QPA_PLATFORM,wayland;xcb
env = SDL_VIDEODRIVER,wayland
env = CLUTTER_BACKEND,wayland
env = XDG_CURRENT_DESKTOP,Hyprland
env = XDG_SESSION_TYPE,wayland
env = XDG_SESSION_DESKTOP,Hyprland
env = QT_AUTO_SCREEN_SCALE_FACTOR,1
env = GTK_THEME,Breeze-Dark
env = QT_STYLE_OVERRIDE,Breeze-Dark
env = XCURSOR_THEME,Future-Cursors
env = XCURSOR_SIZE,24
env = QT_WAYLAND_DISABLE_WINDOWDECORATION,1
exec-once=gsettings set org.gnome.desktop.interface cursor-theme 'Future-cursors'
exec-once=hyprctl setcursor Future-cursors 24
monitor=eDP-1,highres,auto,1.5

Also i did set cursor size using `nwg-look` to 24 also

and I still have issues with firefox ( native not flatpak ) and other apps where I see my cursor in the desktop pretty normal sized and when I hover the mouse around the waybar or when opening and moveing my cursor in it it get resized and become bigger. Furthermore, when I use `rofi` menu the mouse become tiny  even if i try passing --dpi argument :(. In addition, using when using any screen recoreding software using Pipewire (Like OBS and wf-recoreder was tested also ) the mouse become dramatically oversized and here like that and affect every other program until I close it:
https://github.com/hyprwm/Hyprland/assets/88736671/b68b00e6-97f8-4e03-9bee-9c1c6d1c1e38
It might be related to scaling because when I get selecting resolution I got 1280 X 720 while my screen is Full HD:
![image](https://github.com/hyprwm/Hyprland/assets/88736671/0f645a9d-afaa-4320-8a86-3d3a0769852a)
for now OBS and rofi problems are unsolvable while cursor size on the bar and other applications could be fixed with changing the cursor size using `nwg-look` to match desktop cursor size.

### Setup

-  (AMD + Nvidia) Laptop but using AMD Primarily 
- Hyprland on latest version (0.26.0) with nvidia patch
- Arch Linux 

If you need any further information or configuration to try just let me know

Edit : After some further investigations I have found that with Fractional scaling some apps and games also are recognizing my monitor as 1280 X 720 and not 1920 X 1080 , and I think it might be the problem for this weird mouse changing

title: Fix fractional scale updates in some cases
body:
#### Describe your PR, what does it fix/add?

The fractional scale of windows was not updated on "keyboard" moves (`movecurrentworkspacetomonitor` and `movetoworkspace` if the target workspace is on a different monitor), while it worked as expected when dragging a window with the mouse. Similar to https://github.com/hyprwm/Hyprland/issues/1794. Although that issue was already fixed, I am observing the same behavior on current `main`.

#### Is there anything you want to mention? (unchecked code, possible bugs, found problems, breaking compatibility, etc.)

This is my first time doing anything with Hyprland (or even Wayland for that matter), so not sure if I did it right.

In `CWindow::moveToWorkspace()`, the scale used appears to be the one from the previous monitor (where the window used to be), but I'm not sure if there are any unintended side-effects from setting `m_iMonitorID`. If that is bad, the scaling behavior was also fixed by only creating `PMONITOR` from `PWORKSPACE->m_iMonitorID`.

#### Is it ready for merging, or does it need work?

Apart from the above disclaimer, I think it's ready (for what it's worth). I tested it with two monitors of different scale (2.0 and 1.6), and alacritty as client.

title: wip: FEATURE Scaling for rounded borders
body:
#### Describe your PR, what does it fix/add?
My PR (once it is done) plans on adding a scaling option to the radius of rounded corners based, for example, on the location of the corner (top left etc...) or if its a corner on the outside or inside.

#### Is there anything you want to mention? (unchecked code, possible bugs, found problems, breaking compatibility, etc.)
The reason i went with an approach of scaling rather then overriding specific corners is that one can simply multiply multiple corner modifiers together for a simpler and non compatibility breaking  configuration.

So far my code is horrendous due to the fact that i'm having trouble understanding the current code base. 

#### Is it ready for merging, or does it need work?
It needs a lot of work, im just opening the PR now if someone wants to help me in this venture.

title: Hyprland performance issues
body:
Hyprland has a noticeable performance difference between it and other wayland compositors
Examples:
Tinywl
Wayfire
Labwc

And in some cases it also affects general use (Moving a window, Animations, Ect)

Steps to reproduce:
Install hyprland
Launch hyprland
Run glxgears or glmark

Expected outcome:
A lot of fps

Actual outcome:
Approximately 2.3 times less fps than alternatives

This is just a performance issue not a crash issue

Notes:
Performance issues occur on my daily driver (i7-9700F rtx 3060 ti) and all models of raspberry pi
Performance issues do not occur on my M2 Mac which is not supported at all by hyprland and has visual issues

title: Crash in group handling
body:
Reproduce like this:
1. open a single window
2. make it a group with togglegroup
3. open another window that gets added to that group
4. use movetoworkspace to move the focused window to another workspace (this enters the weird stage explained in https://github.com/hyprwm/Hyprland/issues/2229
5. close the window
6. go back to the workspace with the group (now containing only one window)
7. togglegroup
8. Crash!

title: hyprctl dispatch dpms on doesn't turn on one of the monitors
body:
I use a laptop with 3 displays in total: builtin screen and 2 monitors plugged in via Thunderbolt dock.

Everything works smoothly until I try to wake up the displays with `hyprctl dispatch dpms on`. The internal display and one external monitor turn on without any problems but the second external display stays turned off. It's always the same monitor.

Output of `hyprctl monitors`:
```
Monitor eDP-1 (ID 0):
	1920x1080@60.012001 at 0x325
	description: BOE 0x074F (eDP-1)
	make: BOE
	model: 0x074F
	serial:
	active workspace: 8 (8)
	reserved: 0 50 0 0
	scale: 1.00
	transform: 0
	focused: no
	dpmsStatus: 1
	vrr: 0

Monitor DP-4 (ID 1):
	2560x1440@59.951000 at 1920x325
	description: Dell Inc. DELL P2421D FJWHGC3 (DP-4)
	make: Dell Inc.
	model: DELL P2421D
	serial: FJWHGC3
	active workspace: 3 (3)
	reserved: 0 50 0 0
	scale: 1.00
	transform: 0
	focused: yes
	dpmsStatus: 1
	vrr: 0

Monitor DP-5 (ID 2):
	2560x1440@59.951000 at 4480x0
	description: Dell Inc. DELL P2421D CGSHL93 (DP-5)
	make: Dell Inc.
	model: DELL P2421D
	serial: CGSHL93
	active workspace: 6 (6)
	reserved: 0 50 0 0
	scale: 1.00
	transform: 3
	focused: no
	dpmsStatus: 1
	vrr: 0
```
The problematic monitor is DP-5. It was still asleep after doing DPMS off & on when I got that output above.

The only log that seems to be related looks as follow:
```
[ERR] Couldn't commit output DP-5
[LOG] Hyprctl: dispatcher dpms : on
```

<hr>

Thanks for working on hyprland, it's awesome!

title: Make movetoworkspace register previous workspace
body:
#### Describe your PR, what does it fix/add?
`movetoworkspace` didn't register previous workspace so there was no way to go back to previous workspace by using `workspace, previous` even if `binds/allow_workspace_cycles` is enabled.

Fixed it such that `movetoworkspace` will update the previous workspace if `binds/allow_workspace_cycles` is enabled.

#### Is there anything you want to mention? (unchecked code, possible bugs, found problems, breaking compatibility, etc.)
No.

#### Is it ready for merging, or does it need work?

Ready to merge.

title: Add hot corner functionality
body:
Hot corners would be a small but useful addition to Hyprland. The idea is that an action occurs when the mouse is moved into a specific corner of the desktop for a certain amount of time (e.g. 200ms), with or without specified modifier keys.

I am only aware of it being implemented on MacOS, but the functions you can assign to it there are very limited so it can only be more potent on Hyprland.

Some functions which are useful to assign to the corners are to run an app launcher, activate a screen locker, toggle a special workspace, cycle through workspaces, or run really any command relevant to a certain workflow.

The overall effect of this feature is that it gives the mouse considerably more power to activate functions in the desktop environment.
This video demonstrates the concept briefly: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PaxFUybMbng

title: m_sWLRBackend was NULL! after re-login
body:
### Steps to Reproduce
*from start*
login through lemurs login manager
execute `hyprctl dispatchers exit` or `hyprctl dispatch exit` or `pkill Hyprland`
 -this takes me to lemurs login manager again
re-login 
Hyprland crashes and opens lemurs again

### Expected Behavior
*from start*
login through lemurs login manager
execute `hyprctl dispatchers exit` or `hyprctl dispatch exit` or `pkill Hyprland`
 -this takes me to lemurs login manager again
re-login 

### Notes

- I have not tried with other login managers, however all this one does to open Hyprland is executing a bash script that is:

```
#! /bin/sh 
exec Hyprland
```

- Usually I use Ulauncher-System to log out, but all that does is execute the aforementioned commands.

```

#default monitor settings
monitor=,preferred,auto,auto
#monitor=DVI-D-1,1920x1080@144,0x0,1

# Execute at launch
exec-once = ulauncher --hide-window 
exec-once = dunst -c ~/.config/dunst/dunst.conf 
exec-once = swaybg -i ~/Pictures/wallpaper.png 
exec-once = /usr/lib/polkit-kde-authentication-agent-1 
#exec-once = ckb-next -b
exec-once = ~/.config/hypr/import-gsettings #workaround for gtk on wayland
exec-once = swayidle & disown # for screen locking

# Some default env vars.
env = XCURSOR_SIZE,24
env = MOZ_ENABLE_WAYLAND, 1

#used for programs like ulauncher to detect session type
env = XDG_CURRENT_DESKTOP,Hyprland
env = XDG_SESSION_TYPE,wayland
env = XDG_SESSION_DESKTOP,Hyprland

blurls=swaylock


misc {
    disable_hyprland_logo=true
    disable_splash_rendering=true
    animate_manual_resizes = true
    groupbar_gradients = false
}

input {
    kb_layout = us
    kb_variant =
    kb_model =
    kb_options =
    kb_rules =

    follow_mouse = 1

    touchpad {
        natural_scroll = 1
        middle_button_emulation=1
    }

    sensitivity = 0 # -1.0 - 1.0, 0 means no modification.
}

general {
    # See https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Variables/ for more

    gaps_in = 10
    gaps_out = 20
    border_size = 1
    no_border_on_floating = true
    col.active_border = rgba(bfffffff)
    col.inactive_border = rgba(00000000)

    col.group_border = rgba(00000000)
    col.group_border_active = rgba(bfffffff)
    layout = dwindle
    resize_on_border = true

}

decoration {
    # See https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Variables/ for more

    rounding = 10
    blur = yes
    blur_size = 3
    blur_passes = 3
    blur_new_optimizations = true

    drop_shadow = true
    shadow_range = 10
    shadow_render_power = 3
    col.shadow = rgba(0a0f0f80)
}

animations {
    enabled = yes

    # Some default animations, see https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Animations/ for more

    bezier = cubic, 0.05, 0.9, 0.1, 1.05

    animation = windows, 1, 5, cubic
    animation = windowsOut, 1, 10, default, popin 80%
    animation = windowsIn, 1, 7, default

    animation = border, 1, 5, default
    # animation = borderangle, 1, 50, default, loop
    animation = fade, 1, 10, default
    animation = workspaces, 1, 10, default
}

dwindle {
    # See https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Dwindle-Layout/ for more
    pseudotile = yes # master switch for pseudotiling. Enabling is bound to mainMod + P in the keybinds section below
    preserve_split = yes # you probably want this
}

master {
    # See https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Master-Layout/ for more
    new_is_master = true
}

gestures {
    # See https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Variables/ for more
    workspace_swipe = on
}

# See https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Window-Rules/ for more
# windowrule= workspace empty, title:Sharing Indicator
# windowrule=float, title:PolicyKit1

# See https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Keywords/ for more
$mainMod = SUPER

# lock screen when opened
bindl=,switch:on:Lid Switch,exec,swaylock

# Example binds, see https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Binds/ for more
bind = $mainMod, T, exec, kitty
bind = $mainMod, W, killactive, 
#bind = $mainMod, M, exit, 
bind = $mainMod, E, exec, dolphin
bind = $mainMod, F, togglefloating, 
bind = $mainMod, P, pseudo, # dwindle
bind = $mainMod, D, togglesplit, # dwindle
bind = $mainMod, V, togglegroup,
bind = $mainMod, G, changegroupactive

bindr = SUPER, SUPER_L, exec, ulauncher-toggle #~/.config/rofi/scripts/toggle_menu.sh
#bindr = $mainMod, ESCAPE, exec, ~/.config/rofi/scripts/toggle_power_menu.sh
bind = $mainMod, E, exec, thunar

# for laptop
bindr = , XF86MonBrightnessDown, exec, brightnessctl set 5%-
bindr = , XF86MonBrightnessUp, exec, brightnessctl set 5%+

bindr = , XF86AudioLowerVolume, exec, amixer set Master playback 5-
bindr = , XF86AudioRaiseVolume, exec, amixer set Master playback 5+
bind = , XF86AudioMute, exec, amixer set Master toggle

bind = , XF86AudioMicMute, exec, amixer set Dmic0 toggle

bind = SUPER_L, F1, exec, kitty --hold neofetch # for some reason help doesn't have it's own name.
bindm = SUPER_CONTROL, mouse:272, resizewindow

# Move focus with mainMod + arrow keys
bind = $mainMod, left, movefocus, l
bind = $mainMod, right, movefocus, r
bind = $mainMod, up, movefocus, u
bind = $mainMod, down, movefocus, d

# Switch workspaces with mainMod + [0-9]
bind = $mainMod, 1, workspace, 1
bind = $mainMod, 2, workspace, 2
bind = $mainMod, 3, workspace, 3
bind = $mainMod, 4, workspace, 4
bind = $mainMod, 5, workspace, 5
bind = $mainMod, 6, workspace, 6
bind = $mainMod, 7, workspace, 7
bind = $mainMod, 8, workspace, 8
bind = $mainMod, 9, workspace, 9
bind = $mainMod, 0, workspace, 10

# Move active window to a workspace with mainMod + SHIFT + [0-9]
bind = $mainMod SHIFT, 1, movetoworkspace, 1
bind = $mainMod SHIFT, 2, movetoworkspace, 2
bind = $mainMod SHIFT, 3, movetoworkspace, 3
bind = $mainMod SHIFT, 4, movetoworkspace, 4
bind = $mainMod SHIFT, 5, movetoworkspace, 5
bind = $mainMod SHIFT, 6, movetoworkspace, 6
bind = $mainMod SHIFT, 7, movetoworkspace, 7
bind = $mainMod SHIFT, 8, movetoworkspace, 8
bind = $mainMod SHIFT, 9, movetoworkspace, 9
bind = $mainMod SHIFT, 0, movetoworkspace, 10

# Scroll through existing workspaces with mainMod + scroll
bind = $mainMod, mouse_down, workspace, e+1
bind = $mainMod, mouse_up, workspace, e-1

# Move/resize windows with mainMod + LMB/RMB and dragging
bindm = $mainMod, mouse:272, movewindow
bindm = $mainMod, mouse:273, resizewindow
```

Thanks!!!

title: Text gets blurry in popup selection with two monitors
body:
I have two monitors with different resolution and scale coefficient. which is configured with

```ini
# 4k with scale 2
monitor=DP-1,3840x2160,0x0,2
# 1080P with scale 1
monitor=eDP-1,1920x1080@144,1920x0,1
```

And I launched `pavucontrol` (a wayland-native app) in my 4k monitor, then select port, the text in popup is blurry.

![blur](https://github.com/hyprwm/Hyprland/assets/24190403/bf10d039-54d4-427b-b6f9-f45e2e792be8)

An interesting thing is that if I add a small scale coefficient (e.g. 1.0001) to my 1080P monitor, text will not be blurry. But if the scale coefficient is less or equal to 1, text gets blurry.

![nonblur](https://github.com/hyprwm/Hyprland/assets/24190403/df43b51c-7d2a-4cce-80d5-50fedd8e2517)

title: Add support for libinput scroll button lock
body:
This is similar to scroll_method = on_button_down, except that it does not require that the button be held down. Instead the button acts as a lock; press the button to turn scrolling on, press it again to return to normal mouse movement.

This would be a significant accessibility improvement.

https://wayland.freedesktop.org/libinput/doc/latest/scrolling.html#on-button-scrolling

title: Screen freezes randomly
body:
When logging into hyprland, randomly the screen will freeze and no updates to the screen are visible. Sometimes this happens a few minutes after startup, sometimes there is not a problem all day. I'm still able to interact with the system. I'm able to kill Hyprland or reboot the system by mimicking the key presses I would normally use, however, nothing changes on the screen. No terminal pops up and the mouse doesn't move. Running this on arcolinux (arch derivative). Attached is the hyprland log file 
[hyprlandLog.txt](https://github.com/hyprwm/Hyprland/files/11641938/hyprlandLog.txt), the crash report
[hyprlandCrashReport2792.txt](https://github.com/hyprwm/Hyprland/files/11641947/hyprlandCrashReport2792.txt), and my config file 
[hyprland.txt](https://github.com/hyprwm/Hyprland/files/11641955/hyprland.txt).


Not sure if the crash report is referring to when I am forced to exit Hyprland. Therefore, coredumpctl does not give any PIDs for me to post the info of.  Please let me know if I can provide any more information. I switched from the linux-lts kernel to the standard linux kernel before writing this. So far, it seems as if there has been no freezing issues, however, as I mentioned the freezing happens at random it seems.

title: Fences
body:
# Overview
Virtual fences inside a workspace would make it easier to group applications.
Each fence would have its own window tiling, resizing one application wouldn't affect the position/layout of its neighbor fence.
**Think of it like using multiple workspaces on one screen which is especially useful when working on a ultrawide monitor.**

# Example
For instance, here's a visualization of 2 fences in one workspace (they're separated by a dark line).
Applications in the left fence have their own tiling and wouldn't be affected by the layout of the right fence:
![example](https://github.com/hyprwm/Hyprland/assets/45666572/3f25b6ff-09d3-43d5-8ba2-ba9cfdbe589b)

title: feat: add ipc set title window event
body:
Hi, 

This is a very basic PR to be able to get an event only when a window title change. (active and inactive windows)

This will allow me to refresh https://github.com/hyprland-community/hyprland-autoname-workspaces on title update.

Also, hyprland-rs PR is ready for this: https://github.com/hyprland-community/hyprland-rs/pull/56/files

I don't understand/know if we need also to add a `EMIT_HOOK_EVENT("windowTitle", PWINDOW);`

Should I ?

title: Fullscreen maximize prevents from clicking to bar (waybar)
body:
`Hyprland version 0.26.0 - 51a930f802c71a0e67f05e7b176ded74e8e95f87`

If I put a window to Fullscreen (maximize)
```
bind = $mainMod, F, fullscreen, 1
```
and I try to click on my bar (e.g. alt format for date) the click does not reach the bar.

Not sure if this is more waybar related, but my initial thought was that hyprland does overlay here.

# utility
# launcher
bind = $mod, P, exec, /nix/store/sprfkvl9adpacg6ya9pfkwcry8m22a5y-wofi-1.3/bin/wofi --show run -W 400 -H 300
# terminal
# bind = $mod, Return, exec, run-as-service $term
bind = $mod, Return, exec, $term
# logout menu
bind = $mod, Escape, exec, wlogout -p layer-shell
# lock screen
bind = $mod, X, exec, loginctl lock-session
# emoji picker
bind = $mod, E, exec, /nix/store/nnvn6bhj1r0qlxfcn002w4wrl7ycwvwy-wofi-emoji-unstable-2022-08-19/bin/wofi-emoji
# select area to perform OCR on
bind = $mod, O, exec, run-as-service wl-ocr

# move focus
bind = $mod, H, movefocus, l
bind = $mod, L, movefocus, r
bind = $mod, K, movefocus, u
bind = $mod, J, movefocus, d

# window resize
bind = $mod, S, submap, resize

# Close window
bind = $mod, C, killactive

submap = resize
binde = , right, resizeactive, 10 0
binde = , left, resizeactive, -10 0
binde = , up, resizeactive, 0 -10
binde = , down, resizeactive, 0 10
bind = , escape, submap, reset
submap = reset

# media controls
bindl = , XF86AudioPlay, exec, playerctl play-pause
bindl = , XF86AudioPrev, exec, playerctl previous
bindl = , XF86AudioNext, exec, playerctl next

# volume
bindle = , XF86AudioRaiseVolume, exec, wpctl set-volume @DEFAULT_AUDIO_SINK@ 6%+
bindle = , XF86AudioLowerVolume, exec, wpctl set-volume @DEFAULT_AUDIO_SINK@ 6%-
bindl = , XF86AudioMute, exec, wpctl set-mute @DEFAULT_AUDIO_SINK@ toggle
bindl = , XF86AudioMicMute, exec, wpctl set-mute @DEFAULT_AUDIO_SOURCE@ toggle

# backlight
bindle = , XF86MonBrightnessUp, exec, light -A 5
bindle = , XF86MonBrightnessDown, exec, light -U 5

# screenshot
# stop animations while screenshotting; makes black border go away
$screenshotarea = hyprctl keyword animation "fadeOut,0,0,default"; grimblast --notify copysave area; hyprctl keyword animation "fadeOut,1,4,default"
bind = , Print, exec, $screenshotarea
bind = $mod SHIFT, R, exec, $screenshotarea

bind = CTRL, Print, exec, grimblast --notify --cursor copysave output
bind = $mod SHIFT CTRL, R, exec, grimblast --notify --cursor copysave output

bind = ALT, Print, exec, grimblast --notify --cursor copysave screen
bind = $mod SHIFT ALT, R, exec, grimblast --notify --cursor copysave screen

# workspaces
# binds mod + [shift +] {1..10} to [move to] ws {1..10}
bind = $mod, 1, workspace, 1
bind = $mod SHIFT, 1, movetoworkspace, 1

bind = $mod, 2, workspace, 2
bind = $mod SHIFT, 2, movetoworkspace, 2

bind = $mod, 3, workspace, 3
bind = $mod SHIFT, 3, movetoworkspace, 3

bind = $mod, 4, workspace, 4
bind = $mod SHIFT, 4, movetoworkspace, 4

bind = $mod, 5, workspace, 5
bind = $mod SHIFT, 5, movetoworkspace, 5

bind = $mod, 6, workspace, 6
bind = $mod SHIFT, 6, movetoworkspace, 6

bind = $mod, 7, workspace, 7
bind = $mod SHIFT, 7, movetoworkspace, 7

bind = $mod, 8, workspace, 8
bind = $mod SHIFT, 8, movetoworkspace, 8

bind = $mod, 9, workspace, 9
bind = $mod SHIFT, 9, movetoworkspace, 9

bind = $mod, 0, workspace, 10
bind = $mod SHIFT, 0, movetoworkspace, 10


# special workspace
bind = $mod SHIFT, grave, movetoworkspace, special
bind = $mod, grave, togglespecialworkspace, eDP-1

# cycle workspaces
bind = $mod, bracketleft, workspace, m-1
bind = $mod, bracketright, workspace, m+1

# cycle monitors
bind = $mod SHIFT, braceleft, focusmonitor, l
bind = $mod SHIFT, braceright, focusmonitor, r
```

title: Aesthetic requests for group bars
body:
1. Drop shadow behind group bar text
2. Drop shadow behind group bar line (when gradient disabled)
3. Configurable stroke width of group bar line (height)
   - Option to either offset text, or overlap behind text
4. Configurable padding between group bar lines
5. Configurable radius of group bar line
6. Configurable color of active/inactive group bar line (separate from border)
7. Text below or above bar

Perhaps 3 and 7 could be solved with "text offset" and "bar offset", positive or negative for both

I am not sure what style I would choose, but what I'm after is this:
1. Rounded rectangle with custom color (similar to https://github.com/outfoxxed/hy3)
   - Text on top of bar
2. Drop shadow (separate from border) behind the bar and text
   - Text below the bar

Note: I'm using the Hyprland-nvidia-git package from the AUR

Steps to reproduce: Close any window (tested with alacritty, firefox and mpv)

title: Client monitor value on the special workspace does not change
body:
Hi,

Actually I'm not sure whether it's a bug or a feature.

Starting from v0.26.0, `togglespecialworkspace` will show the special workspace on the currently focused monitor. However, for clients on the special workspace, the client `monitor` value remains always the same, equal to the `id` of the monitor the client was moved to the special workspace on. Is it intentional, or could it be fixed?

title: Jetbrains IDEs focus/rerendering problem
body:
While using a jetbrains IDE, eg. IntelliJ, moving the cursor to the edge of the window it looses and regains focus or rerenders causing the hyprland to be very slow.

Steps to reproduce:
While having IntelliJ open move the cursor near the edge of the window, like you wanted to expand a tool window on the left. When you move the cursor around in this area without leaving the window the focus starts flickering. Doing this for a while causes hyprland to become very slow until you switch workspaces.

The Problem persists ins every jetbrains IDE I tried. 
I currently use the new UI beta of jetbrains, but switching back to the old one did not solve the problem.
It seems to be a similar problem to #2245

title: Hyprland Crash after closing Rofi or Wofi
body:
I updated my package to the latest hyprland-git version (hyprland-git-r2953.e76bd43f-1), and it instantly crashes. I'm new to Hyprland so I don't really have any idea for why it does, but i can at least consistently reproduce that bug : 

How to reproduce :

1. Update hyprland-git (hyprland-git-r2953.e76bd43f-1)
2. Reboot or Relog to the Hyprland Session
3. Open wofi or Rofi (using rofi/wofi -show drun)
4. Escape from Rofi/Wofi 
5. Crash and back to Greetd screen

title: WM Completely Crashes With RuneLite For Seemingly No Reason (FAULT_PTE ACCESS_TYPE_VIRT_READ)
body:
I've been having this problem very consistently where my Hyprland just entirely crashes when playing RuneLite. I've changed every variable possible inside the game and it is still happening, and every lead I've had has been a dead end.
I've tried disabling GPU plugins, gamescope, window options, disabling steam overlay, and not moving my mouse out of the game, and it is still happening.
After trying to check Hyprland, I've found a lot of interesting things. The error that someone pointed me to was "ENGINE GRAPHICS GPCCLIENT_PROP_0 faulted @ 0x1_007f0000. Fault is of type FAULT_PTE ACCESS_TYPE_VIRT_READ"
The same error happened about 5 times with different memory addresses at the same time.
This same error also appeared several times before this in different situations, but nothing bad seemingly happened, or was something pretty minor.
I'm not an expert at all, so I'll attach the most logs and information I can, and hope that is enough to pinpoint the issue.
I've been trying to troubleshoot this for 2 days, but frankly I am lost, and would appreciate it any help, since I am very frustrated and just want to play the game :(.

[hyprlandlogs1.txt](https://github.com/hyprwm/Hyprland/files/11619333/hyprlandlogs1.txt)
[hyprlandCrashReport158749.txt](https://github.com/hyprwm/Hyprland/files/11619326/hyprlandCrashReport158749.txt)
[hyprlandCrashReport143657.txt](https://github.com/hyprwm/Hyprland/files/11619327/hyprlandCrashReport143657.txt)
https://justpaste.it/d368b

title: Hyprland crashes when trying to capture the screen with Pipewire
body:
When opening OBS, the screen picker appears, and when clicking one of the options, Hyprland (hyprland-git e76bd43) crashes.

Steps to reproduce:
- Open OBS
- Add a Screen Capture (Pipewire)
- Select a monitor 

[hyprland_152577.log](https://github.com/hyprwm/Hyprland/files/11619319/hyprland_152577.log)
[coredump_152577.txt](https://github.com/hyprwm/Hyprland/files/11619320/coredump_152577.txt)
[hyprlandCrashReport152577.txt](https://github.com/hyprwm/Hyprland/files/11619322/hyprlandCrashReport152577.txt)
[config](https://github.com/uku3lig/dotfiles/blob/master/.config/hypr/hyprland.conf)

title: window group are not working as expected
body:
<!-- For Nix issues, ping @fufexan -->

I'm also using hyprsome and pypyland scratchpad just in case this information was needed
Hyprland verison
```
hyprctl version
Hyprland, built from branch  at commit 51a930f802c71a0e67f05e7b176ded74e8e95f87 dirty ().
Tag: v0.26.0

flags: (if any)
```
config related to the issue
```
bind = $mainMod,t, togglegroup
bind = $mainMod,c, moveoutofgroup
bind = $mainMod,x, changegroupactive, f
bind = $mainMod,z, changegroupactive, b

misc {
    #render_titles_in_groupbar	= true
    #groupbar_titles_font_size	 = 20
    #groupbar_text_color
}

```
using master layout

## Steps to reproduce

1. toggle group for current window using `mod``t` => toggles group
2. open another window in the group `mod``space` in my case for terminal => opens terminal in the tab
3. press `mod``t`
both the windows turn into none group.

### another case 2
1. toggle group for current window using `mod``t` => toggles group
2. open another window in the group `mod``space` in my case for terminal => opens terminal in the tab
3.  repeat step 2
3. press `mod``t` (togglegroup)
all three the windows turn into none group.

### another case 3
1. toggle group for current window using `mod``t` => toggles group
2. open another window in the group `mod``space` in my case for terminal => opens terminal in the tab
3.  repeat step 2
3. press `mod``c` (moveoutofgroup)
window in focus moves to master view but focus remains in slave i.e tab group. 
on a side note:  master even though not part of group has a weird gap between the bar. when I try to take screenshot it expands and fixs :) its not a issue but hey ux would be better.
---

## Expected outcome
case1,2:
when a active window is toggled out of a group.
[ ] It should moved to master view
[ ] other windows of the group should be part of windowgroup

case 3:
when a window is moved out of the group.
[x]  it should be in master view
[ ] focus should be on master window as its expected window
[ ] shouldn't have weird gap between bar


---

lmk if i'm doing something fishy it was working somewhat correctly but I didn't have the bar last time. which wasn't a problem. now groupbar is fixed

title: activewindowv2
body:
Is there a reason for the window address  being separated from the activewindow event and placed inside activewindowv2 event?
Would be great if the window address could be added to the activewindow event,

Thanks.

title: Crash on Window Close
body:
There was an update earlier today, since then Hyprland crashed multiple times on closing a window, usually kitty.

# Steps to reproduce
Close a window with Super + C (`killactive`)
Hyprland session closes and SDDM is there, ready for a new login.

# Expected Outcome
Only the active window closes

# Additional comments
1. This only happened after today's update. 
2. I'm using the git version with the nvidia patch from the AUR (https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/hyprland-nvidia-git)
3.  My hyprland configuration
<details>
  <summary>hyprland.conf</summary>
  
  The following configuration was stable until today
  
  ```
########################################################################################
AUTOGENERATED HYPR CONFIG.
PLEASE USE THE CONFIG PROVIDED IN THE GIT REPO /examples/hypr.conf AND EDIT IT,
OR EDIT THIS ONE ACCORDING TO THE WIKI INSTRUCTIONS.
########################################################################################

#
# Please note not all available settings / options are set here.
# For a full list, see the wiki
#

# autogenerated = 1 # remove this line to remove the warning

# See https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Monitors/
# monitor=,preferred,auto,auto
monitor=DP-3,1920x1080@240,0x0,1
monitor=HDMI-A-1,1920x1200@60,1920x0,1


# See https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Keywords/ for more

# Execute your favorite apps at launch
exec-once = hyprpaper & waybar & vivaldi-stable & kitty & kDrive & protonmail-bridge --cli
exec-once = /usr/lib/polkit-kde-authentication-agent-1
exec-once = udiskie &
exec-once = pypr

# Source a file (multi-file configs)
# source = ~/.config/hypr/myColors.conf

# Some default env vars.
env = XCURSOR_SIZE,24
env = LIBVA_DRIVER_NAME,nvidia
env = XDG_SESSION_TYPE,wayland
env = GBM_BACKEND,nvidia-drm
env = __GLX_VENDOR_LIBRARY_NAME,nvidia
env = WLR_NO_HARDWARE_CURSORS,1

# For all categories, see https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Variables/
input {
    kb_layout = eu
    kb_variant =
    kb_model =
    kb_options =
    kb_rules =

    follow_mouse = 1

    touchpad {
        natural_scroll = no
    }

    numlock_by_default = true

    sensitivity = 0 # -1.0 - 1.0, 0 means no modification.
}

general {
    # See https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Variables/ for more

    gaps_in = 5
    gaps_out = 20
    border_size = 2
    col.active_border = rgba(33ccffee) rgba(00ff99ee) 45deg
    col.inactive_border = rgba(595959aa)

    layout = dwindle
}

decoration {
    # See https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Variables/ for more

    rounding = 10
    blur = yes
    blur_size = 3

}

    bezier = myBezier, 0.05, 0.9, 0.1, 1.05

    animation = windows, 1, 7, myBezier
    animation = windowsOut, 1, 7, default, popin 80%
    animation = border, 1, 10, default
    animation = borderangle, 1, 8, default
    animation = fade, 1, 7, default
    animation = workspaces, 1, 6, default,slidevert
}

dwindle {
    # See https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Dwindle-Layout/ for more
    pseudotile = yes # master switch for pseudotiling. Enabling is bound to mainMod + P in the keybind>
    preserve_split = yes # you probably want this
}

master {
    # See https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Master-Layout/ for more
    new_is_master = true
}

gestures {
    # See https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Variables/ for more
    workspace_swipe = off
}

# Example per-device config
# See https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Keywords/#executing for more
device:epic-mouse-v1 {
    sensitivity = -0.5
}

# Example windowrule v1
# windowrule = float, ^(kitty)$
# Example windowrule v2
# windowrulev2 = float,class:^(kitty)$,title:^(kitty)$
# See https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Window-Rules/ for more
windowrule = opacity 1.0 override 0.75 override,^(thunar)$ # set opacity to 1.0 active and 0.5 inactiv>


# See https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Keywords/ for more
$mainMod = SUPER
# Example binds, see https://wiki.hyprland.org/Configuring/Binds/ for more
bind = $mainMod, Q, exec, kitty
bind = $mainMod, C, killactive,
bind = $mainMod, M, exit,
bind = $mainMod, E, exec, thunar
bind = $mainMod, V, togglefloating,

bind = $mainMod, P, pseudo, # dwindle

bind = $mainMod, B, exec, vivaldi-stable

# Screenshots with hyprshot

bind = $mainMod, PRINT, exec, hyprshot -m window -o /home/kl/Screenshots/
# Screenshot a monitor
bind = , PRINT, exec, hyprshot -m output -o /home/kl/Screenshots/

# Dropdown Kitty Terminal
bind = $mainMod,F12,exec,pypr toggle term
$dropterm  = ^(kitty-dropterm)$

# Move focus with mainMod + arrow keys

bind = $mainMod, right, movefocus, r
bind = $mainMod, up, movefocus, u
bind = $mainMod, down, movefocus, d

# Move Active Window to other monitor
bind = $mainMod, KP_End, movewindow, mon:DP-3
bind = $mainMod, KP_Next, movewindow, mon:HDMI-A-1

# Switch workspaces with mainMod + [0-9]
bind = $mainMod, 1, workspace, 1
bind = $mainMod, 2, workspace, 2
bind = $mainMod, 3, workspace, 3
bind = $mainMod, 4, workspace, 4
bind = $mainMod, 5, workspace, 5
bind = $mainMod, 6, workspace, 6
bind = $mainMod, 7, workspace, 7                              
bind = $mainMod, 8, workspace, 8
bind = $mainMod, 9, workspace, 9
bind = $mainMod, 0, workspace, 10

# Swap the workspaces of all the screens
bind = $mainMod, KP_Begin, exec, pypr shift_monitors +1

# Make non-visible workspace follow the focused monitor
bind = $mainMod, KP_Insert, exec, pypr change_workspace +1
bind = $mainMod, KP_Down, exec, pypr change_workspace -1

#bind = SUPER, KP_End, workspace, 1
#bind = SUPER, KP_Down, workspace, 2
#bind = SUPER, KP_Next, workspace, 3

#bind = SUPER, KP_Prior, workspace, 9
#bind = SUPER, KP_Insert, workspace, 10

# Move active window to a workspace with mainMod + SHIFT + [0-9]
bind = $mainMod SHIFT, 1, movetoworkspace, 1
bind = $mainMod SHIFT, 2, movetoworkspace, 2
bind = $mainMod SHIFT, 3, movetoworkspace, 3
bind = $mainMod SHIFT, 4, movetoworkspace, 4

bind = $mainMod SHIFT, 9, movetoworkspace, 9
bind = $mainMod SHIFT, 0, movetoworkspace, 10

# Scroll through existing workspaces with mainMod + scroll
bind = $mainMod, mouse_down, workspace, e+1
bind = $mainMod, mouse_up, workspace, e-1

# Move/resize windows with mainMod + LMB/RMB and dragging
bindm = $mainMod, mouse:272, movewindow
bindm = $mainMod, mouse:273, resizewindow

# Multimedia Keys
bind =  , XF86AudioMute, exec, wpctl set-mute @DEFAULT_AUDIO_SINK@ toggle
binde = , XF86AudioLowerVolume, exec, wpctl set-volume @DEFAULT_AUDIO_SINK@ 5%-
binde = , XF86AudioRaiseVolume, exec, wpctl set-volume -l 1.5 @DEFAULT_AUDIO_SINK@ 5%+

title: One-off crash when switching workspaces
body:
steps (unable to reproduce):
1. Adjust config, by adding `exec-once = dunst` during the same session
1. Move window (kitty) to new workspace 9 using Windows+Shift+9 (`$mainMod, 9, workspace, 9`).
2. Move window (kitty) to existing workspace 1 using Windows+Shift+1
3. See hyprland crashing

title: 1 pixel gaps on no-gap settings
body:
![photo_2023-05-31_00-49-02](https://github.com/hyprwm/Hyprland/assets/80675742/2853ca88-0d5a-410d-8799-cd29bcb37f2e)

    Steps to reproduce
gaps_in = 0
gaps_out = 0
border_size = 1
master layout 

    Expected outcome
no gaps between windows

    Noted outcome
1px gap
it doesn't matter if i change window size

title: Android Studio tooltips taking focus
body: Tooltips in android studio are taking focus away from the android studio window.  This is a new issue that appeared to me in that past couple weeks.

title: Allow for Ignoring all Keybinds if Rules are Met
body: I wish a window rule be added which will make it ignore any keybinds. This can be useful for RDP software where the remote system uses same keybinds as the local system. So you could add a rule that says "If X app is Fullscreend, ignore keybinds".

title: Resize window after ungrouping a single window group
body: ungrouping a group of 1 window doesn't change the window size to fill the space previously occupied by the group indicator bar.

title: movefocus broken.
body:
Since a few commits movefocus doesn't work anymore for me. 
Sometimes it's possible to use it once, after that there is no effect at all for any direction.

title: Crash when moving a pinned floating window to special workspace
body:
## Steps to reproduce

1. Open a terminal emulator (I'm using `kitty`, but don't think it matters).
2. Make the window floating and pin.
3. Inside that terminal, run `hyprctl dispatch movetoworkspace silent special`. Nothing appears to happen.
4. Quickly spam `CTRL+D` inside the terminal until hyprland crashes.

title: Unbreak build with libc++
body: See [std::floor](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/numeric/math/floor) and [std::sqrt](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/numeric/math/sqrt) docs.

title: Discord and steam not opening after closing window, Tool bar in gimp, nemo dont open after opening and closing.
body:
Whenever i launches discord or steam when i closes its window to manage workspace and let it run in the background. The app window cant be relaunched and needs to kill the app/exit and relaunch it.

Even Tool bar of gimp and nemo are not working so editing images are a pain now. Tool bar of steam is not even accessible.

title: [hyprctl] Expose the special workspace id and name of the monitor
body:
So that we know if a special workspace is shown on a monitor

#### Describe your PR, what does it fix/add?
It adds an `specialWorkspace.id` field to the output of hyprctl.

#### Is there anything you want to mention? (unchecked code, possible bugs, found problems, breaking compatibility, etc.)
The added info allows me to workaround https://github.com/hyprwm/Hyprland/issues/2391 by writing a script to interact with hyprctl https://github.com/15cm/nixfiles/commit/561eb3a46d3f3a362e10dc35d4c8e0717ebc00a1

#### Is it ready for merging, or does it need work?
It's ready for merging. I've tried it locally with the hyprland binary on NixOS built on https://github.com/15cm/nixfiles/commit/561eb3a46d3f3a362e10dc35d4c8e0717ebc00a1. I didn't find a code format guideline in the repo. So I just format the code following the existing examples.

title: `dispatch focusmonitor <monitor_name>` doesn't focus on the displayed special workspace of the target monitor
body:
Steps:
* Have two monitors called DP-1 and DP-2
* Move a window to the special workspace (-99) and then `togglespecialworkspace` to have the special workspace displayed on DP-1
* `hyprctl dispatch focusmonitor DP-2`
* `hyprctl dispatch focusmonitor DP-1`

Expected result: The window of the special workspace on DP-1 is focused for both mouse and keyboard.

Actual result: The window of the previous non-special workspace on DP-1 is focused for both mouse and keyboard.

Note: I have `input.follow_mouse = 2` to separate the focus of mouse and keyboard.

title: crash: (Un)fullscreen window with active display capture
body:
**To reproduce:** Start up OBS, select a display (I am using XDPH) for screen capture, then (un)fullscreen a window on that display.

**Expected outcome:** The window will change state

**Outcome:** Hyprland segfaults

Happens on git version from `hyprland-git` AUR package. Rebuilt with `make debug` and ran, still encountered the issue. The crash report doesn't seem to contain line numbers or anything of the sort, though? If anything else is helpful let me know and I can provide it.

I noticed that in this case, the log mentions "scanout mode" even though I do not have `no_direct_scanout = false` in my config. Not sure if relevant, still seems to happen when explicitly setting `no_direct_scanout = true`.

title: Green artifacts in Hyprland with AMD GPUs
body:
Ever since switching my Nvidia GPU for an AMD one (7900 xtx to be precise) I have noticed green horizontal artifact-like lines in games/benchmarks whose FPS exceeded 100. I have tested running the same games/benchmarks on Plasma X11 and Plasma Wayland to check that it was not a faulty card and the artifacts do not show there. I have seen another user in reddit who noticed the same issue: https://www.reddit.com/r/linux_gaming/comments/13qb6k9/anyone_see_green_horizontal_linesartifacts_with/

The artifacts happen both with the v0.25.0 release and the AUR git version.

My display is 4k 144 Hz, and the games/benchmarks tested have been Doom Eternal and Unigine Superposition (available here for testing: https://benchmark.unigine.com/superposition).

- Steps to reproduce
Run a game/benchmark with a frame-rate exceeding 100 fps.

- Expected outcome
No green horizontal artifact-like lines.

- Noted outcome
Green horizontal artifact-like lines flashing on the screen.

title: Hyprland keeps hyprctl connections open after `dispatch exec`
body:
## Description
`.socket.sock` is not closed after `dispatch exec` command has completed. Basically as long dispatched command is running socket will stay open. Which means there is no reliable way to work with this socket, `hyprctl` for example just tries to read 8192 bytes, and quits, and it is not how you are supposed to work with socket. You need to read from it until it reads zero bytes, this is how you make sure there is nothing left to read.

## What is going on
I did some digging it looks like, those connections are kept alive because they are inherited by the spawned process. Which means even tough it is closed on the hyprland side it is kept open by the child process.

## How to fix
All socket must be `CLOEXEC` by either:
 - `fcntl(fd, F_SETFD, FD_CLOEXEC)`
 - or during creation with `SOCK_CLOEXEC`

title: An always on top windowrule for floating windows
body:
Hi, been using Hyprland for just over a week and have been enjoying it a lot so thanks for all your work!

I use the fullscreen mode of hyprland quite often and use apps (i.e. firefox's picture-in-picture mode or custom drop-down terminal from pyprland) that I would want to stay always on top of other windows, but they vanish when I enter fullscreen mode or render behind other floating windows if I switch focus (pin doesn't work if the application was already launched before).

I understand the idea of fullscreen is meant to keep only the said window front and center but in a practical scenario, it would be nice to be able to add a rule to keep certain windows on top.

tl;dr A windowrule to set floating windows to always render on top of other applications in fullscreen or floating mode.

title: Show desktop/hide-unhide windows
body:
Hi!

I think it would be neat if there was a way to hide all the active windows on a workspace and show just the desktop (possibly while a key is being held) and then bring the windows back(once the key press is released).

The use case i'm imagining is to have a eww dashboard instead of a status bar like waybar or hybrid just hanging around on the bottom layer which i could just quickly check for the time/application launch and then go back to work.

Thank you!

title: Relative positioning of monitor
body:
Add relative position of monitors in config.

It could be easier to specify a position relatively to another monitor, instead of an absolute position value.
A feature similar to xrandr `--left-of`, `--right-of`, `--above`, `--bellow` 

The syntax would be
```hypr
monitor = [monitor], <resolution>, direction:<monitor>, <scale>
```
Example:
```hypr
monitor = DP-1, preferred, auto, auto
monitor = DP-2, preferred, above:DP-1, auto
```
with the options
- `above`
- `bellow`
- `left`
- `right`

title: Mouse not locking in Wine/Proton programs in fullscreen or windowed
body:
It seems like I've found a major bug that could push away a lot of people playing games on Hyprland, It's got to do with mouse locking. Every time I run a game under Wine or Proton, (might not be exclusive to Wine or Proton) after tabbing out for a while and tab back in, the mouse locking is broken. The cursor seems to be still moving. I have tested this under Sway to see if the same behaviour could be observed there and after my testing, I can say that this is exclusively Hyprland behaviour. This doesn't look like It's a Proton or Wine bug, I've tested a lot of games extensively under Sway and Hyprland and It looks like Hyprland has some problems to iron out 

Test games were:
Deep Rock Galactic (Proton 7.0-6)
Overwatch 2 (Latest Wine-GE as of 27-05-2023) (DD//MM//YEAR)

Steps to Reproduce:
>Open a game run with Proton or Wine
>Switch to another workspace for a few minutes, maybe 10 if you want to be sure
>Switch back to the game and have your mouse lock ruined

Expected Behaviour
>For the mouse not to lose it's mouse locking properties after 

Noted Outcome:
>Mouse locking breaking after switching to a different workspace

Possible related bugs on the issue tracker:
https://github.com/hyprwm/Hyprland/issues/1732 (This issue is not the same as my mouse doesn't escape into my other monitor all the time but rather it looks like I am locked between certain regions while in-game which is caused by the mouse getting stuck on the edges of the screen.

It is also worth noting that a similar thing happens on Waydroid while trying to run Roblox on it, though it might be a function on Waydroid not working, since there are issues about that open the Waydroid's Github page too. (Can't test because this stopped working for me, will update if I can test)

title: Groupbar exclusive space not reclaimed when toggling group on a single window
body:
# Steps to reproduce

1. Create a group with a single window
2. Untoggle the group
3. Observe that the exclusive space at the top is still present

title: focus: make cursor follow movewindow
body:
#### Describe your PR, what does it fix/add?
Fixes the issue #1830 . The previous attempt at the issue did add the cursor warping but it was moving the cursor to the wrong position, which is the window that the active window is swapping with, not the active window itself.


#### Is there anything you want to mention? (unchecked code, possible bugs, found problems, breaking compatibility, etc.)
No.

#### Is it ready for merging, or does it need work?
Ready. Just a one liner.

title: Add hyprland to waybar-hyprland path as fallback for hyprctl
body:
#### Describe your PR, what does it fix/add?
In some environments, such as using the [home-manager waybar module's systemd integration](https://github.com/nix-community/home-manager/blob/master/modules/programs/waybar.nix#L198), hyprctl may not be in `PATH`. As a result, waybar crashes when attempting to call out to hyprctl to get information for eg. the currently active workspace.

This PR adds a wrapper to the waybar binary, appending hyprctl to `PATH`. This allows waybar to use the current environment's hyprctl, if one exists, and falls back to the default hyprland package if there is none.

#### Is there anything you want to mention? (unchecked code, possible bugs, found problems, breaking compatibility, etc.)
This might not be the most efficient way to do this, as it always pulls the `hyprland` derivation no matter what the user is actually using. People using patched versions of hyprland (eg. `hyprland-nvidia`) would end up pulling two copies of Hyprland into the store. While (to my knowledge) this shouldn't break anything in waybar, this does result in a potentially unnecessary copy of Hyprland being added to the store. I'm open to suggestions on improving this.

#### Is it ready for merging, or does it need work?
Assuming the caveat I described above is fine, this should be ready to merge.

title: Groupbar titles are barely visible if the wallpaper is white
body:
<!-- For Nix issues, ping @fufexan -->

The font color is currently hardcoded, would be great if it's configurable like in hyprbars.

title: Disable exclusive zone for groupbars when neither gradients nor title rendering is enabled.
body:
<!-- For Nix issues, ping @fufexan -->

If neither of those is enabled, the exclusive zone does not bring much benefit.

Alternatively, a config could be added that adds to the calculation of exclusive zone of the groupbars.

title: Stuttering frames
body:
hi there, i'm completely new to this wayland stuff. i have an issue with the frames stuttering on some programs. gaming seems to work perfectly from what i've tested but other applications such as reaper, chrome, discord act very strange.

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1foC8GGKnDunzdEuaqLVFfXAL97r_MZ2t/view?usp=sharing

Here is another video of the same application, but running as fullscreen. Different behaviour.
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1fqVLO9LyfD_7Ia_AoOrXQdG7oxQvcxQB/view?usp=share_link

If it helps:
Kernel: 6.3.4-arch1-1 
CPU: AMD Ryzen 7 5700X (16)  
GPU: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060

Resolution: 2560x1440
Refresh rate: 60

Default environment names: (.config/hypr/hyprland.conf)
env = LIBVA_DRIVER_NAME,nvidia
env = XDG_SESSION_TYPE,wayland
env = GBM_BACKEND,nvidia-drm
env = __GLX_VENDOR_LIBRARY_NAME,nvidia
env = WLR_NO_HARDWARE_CURSORS,1
